newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil to seek WTO panel over EU chicken imports.
newsitem.headline: Brazil to seek WTO panel over EU chicken imports.

text.p: Brazil is more than likely to request that a World Trade Organization (WTO) dispute settlement panel judge import quotas imposed by the European Union on chickens, said a senior Brazilian diplomat.

Jose Alfredo Graca Lima, head of the Foreign Ministry's economics department, said there was a "strong tendency" for Brazil to place the chicken issue on the agenda of the next meeting on June 25 of the WTO's Dispute Settlement Body.
"Within the next weeks Brazil will take a decision to include in the meeting of the dispute settlement body...a request for a panel to judge the situation," Graca Lima said.
He added, "We have not begun the process yet but I would say there is a strong tendency the request will be made."
Brazil has held formal WTO talks with the EU over the quota system and the way it is managed.

Brazil's main complaint is that EU importers control the quota management process and fail to let Brazilian exporters know exactly how much of the quota has been used up. It would like more "transparency", officials say.
Graca Lima said the latest round of talks in April and May had been "inconclusive" and no satisfactory result was reached.
